_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: Hytale
author: contact@natroutter.fi
description:
Hytale is a block-based sandbox game that blends creative building with RPG adventure. Explore procedurally generated worlds filled with unique biomes, dungeons, and creatures. Build anything from simple homes to grand castles, craft items, and battle monsters. Create custom content with built-in modding tools, host your own servers, and shape the experience with plugins and mods. Play solo or with friends in a world designed for both creation and exploration.

Credits:
- Made by NATroutter
- https://natroutter.fi
- https://github.com/NATroutter

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
DOWNLOAD_URL="https://downloader.hytale.com/hytale-downloader.zip"
DOWNLOAD_FILE="hytale-downloader.zip"

# Detect system architecture
ARCH=$(uname -m)
echo "Detected architecture: $ARCH"

apt update
apt install -y curl unzip jq

# Install QEMU user-static for ARM64 systems to run x86_64 binaries
if [ "$ARCH" = "aarch64" ] || [ "$ARCH" = "arm64" ]; then
    echo "ARM64 system detected, installing QEMU for x86_64 emulation..."
    apt install -y qemu-user-static binfmt-support
    
    if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
        echo "Error: Failed to install QEMU"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    echo "âœ“ QEMU installed successfully"
else
    echo "x86_64 system detected, no emulation needed"
fi

cd /mnt/server

# Downloads and extracts the Hytale downloader
echo "Starting Hytale downloader installation..."

# Download the file
echo "Downloading hytale-downloader.zip..."
curl -L -o "${DOWNLOAD_FILE}" "${DOWNLOAD_URL}"

if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    echo "Error: Failed to download ${DOWNLOAD_URL}"
    exit 1
fi

echo "Download completed successfully."

# Extract the zip file
echo "Extracting ${DOWNLOAD_FILE}..."
unzip -o "${DOWNLOAD_FILE}"

if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    echo "Error: Failed to extract ${DOWNLOAD_FILE}"
    exit 1
fi

echo "Extraction completed successfully."

# Remove the unnecessary files
echo "Cleaning up..."
rm "${DOWNLOAD_FILE}"
rm QUICKSTART.md
rm hytale-downloader-windows-amd64.exe

# We keep hytale-downloader-linux-amd64 (x86_64 binary) for all architectures
# On ARM64, it will be run through QEMU

#Creating the empty version file for version checks
if [ ! -f "/mnt/server/version.txt" ]; then
    echo "Creating version check file..."
    touch /mnt/server/version.txt
    chmod 666 /mnt/server/version.txt
else
    echo "Version check file already exists!"
fi

#Creating the empty auth cache file
if [ ! -f "/mnt/server/.hytale-auth-tokens.json" ]; then
    echo "Creating auth cache file..."
    touch /mnt/server/.hytale-auth-tokens.json
    chmod 666 /mnt/server/.hytale-auth-tokens.json
else
    echo "Auth cache already exists!"
fi

# Check if the directory exists
if [ ! -d "/mnt/server/backup" ]; then
    echo "Backup directory does not exist. Creating it..."
    mkdir -p /mnt/server/backup

    if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
        echo "Failed to create backup directory: /backup"
        exit 1
    fi
else
    echo "Backup directory already exists."
fi
chmod -R 755 /mnt/server/backup

echo "Downloading start.sh script..."
curl -L -o start.sh "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/NATroutter/egg-hytale/main/start.sh"

if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    echo "Error: Failed to download start.sh"
    exit 1
fi

echo "Setting executable permissions..."
chmod +x ./hytale-downloader-linux-amd64
chmod +x ./start.sh

echo "Installation complete!"

variables.name: Accept Early Plugins
variables.description: Acknowledge that loading early plugins is unsupported and may cause stability issues

variables.name: Allow Operators
variables.description: Do you wish to allow operators or not

variables.name: Asset Pack
variables.description: Assets pack (.zip) that are being send to player

variables.name: Disable Sentry Crash Reporting
variables.description:
Important: Disable Sentry during active plugin development.

Hytale use Sentry to track crashes. Disable it to avoid submitting your development errors

variables.name: JVM Arguments
variables.description:
Additional Java Virtual Machine arguments for advanced configuration.

Warning: Improper JVM settings can lead to poor performance, crashes, or failure to start. Only modify if you understand what these parameters do.

variables.name: Leverage Ahead-Of-Time Cache
variables.description: The server ships with a pre-trained AOT cache (HytaleServer.aot) that improves boot times by skipping JIT warmup. See https://openjdk.org/jeps/514

variables.name: Game Profile (username)
variables.description:
Specify which Hytale profile should be used for server authentication.

How to find your profile username:
1. Visit https://accounts.hytale.com/
2. Click "Game Profiles" in the left side menu
3. Copy the username of the profile you want to use
4. Paste it into this field

Leave empty to use your default/first profile automatically.

variables.name: Patchline
variables.description: What release channel you want to use

variables.name: Memory overhead
variables.description: The amount of RAM (in MB) kept aside for the system so the server doesn’t use everything. Java will get the rest.
